Sheet1.Description: Start in a high plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle. Push back up to the starting position.
Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended. Curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary. Lower them back down.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your torso. Curl the weights while keeping your palms facing each other. Lower back to the starting position.
Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in one hand, rest your elbow on your inner thigh, and curl the weight up. Lower it back down.
Stand facing a cable machine with a straight bar attached. Grab the bar with an overhand grip and push it down until your arms are fully extended. Slowly return to the starting position.
Stand or sit with a dumbbell held by both hands overhead. Lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows. Extend your arms back to the starting position.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Step forward with one leg and lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the floor. Push back to the starting position and repeat with the other leg.
Sit on a leg extension machine with your feet under the padded bar. Extend your legs until they are straight, then lower them back down.
Lie face down on a leg curl machine with your legs under the padded bar. Curl your legs up towards your buttocks, then lower them back down.
Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Lift your hips towards the ceiling by contracting your glutes. Lower your hips back down.
Stand in front of a bench or platform. Step up with one leg, then bring the other leg up to stand on the bench. Step back down and repeat with the other leg.
For standing calf raises, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and raise your heels off the ground. For seated calf raises, sit on a calf raise machine and push the weight up with your toes.
Start in a forearm plank position with your body in a straight line from head to heels. Hold this position while engaging your core muscles.
Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your hands behind your head. Lift your upper body towards your knees, then lower it back down.
Lie on your back with your legs straight. Lift your legs towards the ceiling while keeping them straight, then lower them back down without letting your feet touch the floor.
Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Lean back slightly and hold your hands together or a weight. Twist your torso to the left, then to the right to complete one rep.
Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and your legs lifted. Bring one knee towards your chest while twisting your opposite elbow towards that knee. Alternate sides in a pedaling motion.
Start in a standing position, drop into a squat with your hands on the ground, kick your feet back into a plank position, perform a push-up, return to the squat position, and then jump up.
Anchor a resistance band at chest height behind you. Hold the handles and press them forward until your arms are fully extended, then return to the starting position.
Lie on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Hold a dumbbell in each hand and press them above your chest, then lower them until your upper arms touch the floor.
Anchor a resistance band at a low point. Sit with your legs extended and grab the handles. Pull the handles towards your torso, then return to the starting position.
Lie face down on the floor with your arms extended in front of you. Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor simultaneously, hold for a few seconds, then lower them back down.
Stand on a resistance band with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the handles with an underhand grip and curl them towards your shoulders, then lower them back down.
Stand facing a cable machine with a low pulley. Grab the bar or handle with an underhand grip and curl it towards your shoulders, then lower it back down.
Sit on the edge of a bench with your hands next to your hips. Slide your hips off the bench and lower your body by bending your elbows. Push back up to the starting position.
Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell at your chest with both hands. Squat down by bending your knees and hips, keeping your chest up. Return to the starting position.
Exercises targeting the hamstrings can include leg curls, Romanian deadlifts, etc.
Stand on a resistance band with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the handles and bend at the hips while keeping your back straight, then return to the starting position.

Attach an ankle strap to a low pulley or use a resistance band. Stand facing the machine and kick one leg back while keeping it straight. Return to the starting position and repeat with the other leg.
Place a resistance band around your legs just above your knees. Step to the side while keeping tension on the band. Continue stepping sideways for the desired distance, then switch directions.
Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg extended. Lift your hips by contracting your glutes, then lower them back down. Repeat with the other leg.
Hold the handles of a jump rope and swing the rope over your head and under your feet. Jump as the rope passes.
Start in a high plank position. Bring one knee towards your chest, then switch legs quickly as if running in place.
Lie on your side with your legs extended. Prop yourself up on one elbow and lift your hips to form a straight line from head to feet. Hold the position.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding a medicine ball. Lift the ball overhead and slam it to the ground with force.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, then return to the starting position.
Start in a high plank position. Bring one knee towards your chest, then switch legs quickly as if running in place.
Stand with feet together and arms at your sides. Jump and spread your legs while bringing your arms overhead. Jump back to the starting position.
Stand on a resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the handles and stand up by extending your hips and knees.
Stand in front of a bench holding dumbbells. Step up onto the bench with one leg, then bring the other leg up. Step back down and repeat with the other leg.
Stand with feet together. Step to the side with one leg and lower your body into a lunge, keeping the other leg straight. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Run in place, lifting your knees as high as possible with each step.
Run in place, kicking your heels up towards your butt with each step.
Hold the handles of a jump rope and swing the rope over your head and under your feet. Jump as the rope passes.
Run in place, lifting your knees to a comfortable height with each step.
Throw punches in the air, incorporating footwork and movement as if boxing an opponent.
Climb stairs at a steady pace. You can increase intensity by running or taking two steps at a time.
Perform dance movements to music, incorporating various dance steps and full-body motions.
Walk or run on a treadmill at a set speed and incline.
Use an elliptical trainer by moving your legs in an elliptical motion and using the handles for upper body movement.
Cycle on a stationary bike at a set resistance and speed.
Climb the steps of a stair climber machine at a set pace and resistance.
Swim using various strokes (freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke, etc.) to work the entire body.
Follow an instructor-led class that involves rhythmic aerobic exercises.
Follow an instructor-led class on a stationary bike, varying speed and resistance.
Follow an instructor-led class that involves kickboxing movements and routines.
Follow an instructor-led dance fitness class with Latin-inspired moves.
Stand and bend forward to touch your toes. Walk your hands forward to a plank position, then walk your feet up to your hands.
Stand in front of a bench or platform. Step up with one leg, then bring the other leg up to stand on the bench. Step back down and repeat with the other leg.
Lie on your side with your legs extended. Prop yourself up on one elbow and lift your hips to form a straight line from head to feet. Hold the position.
Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and your legs lifted. Bring one knee towards your chest while twisting your opposite elbow towards that knee. Alternate sides in a pedaling motion.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a squat and then explosively jump up. Land softly and go directly into the next squat.
Start on all fours with your hands and feet on the ground. Crawl forward by moving your opposite hand and foot simultaneously.
Stand with feet together. Jump up and spread your arms and legs out wide to form a star shape. Land softly and bring your limbs back together.
Perform a series of bodyweight exercises (e.g., push-ups, squats, lunges) in a circuit format with minimal rest between exercises.
Perform a series of exercises (e.g., push-ups, squats, rows) one after the other with minimal rest between exercises.
Alternate between periods of high-intensity jump rope and rest or low-intensity activity.
Follow an instructor-led class that incorporates ballet-inspired movements, isometric holds, and small, controlled movements to strengthen and tone muscles.
Perform dance movements to music, incorporating various dance steps and full-body motions.
Perform dance movements to music, incorporating various dance steps and full-body motions.
A sequence of yoga poses performed in a flowing manner to stretch and strengthen the entire body.
Follow an instructor-led class on a stationary bike, varying speed and resistance.
Use a foam roller to massage and release tight muscles, improving flexibility and aiding in recovery.
Start on all fours and alternate between arching your back (cat) and lowering your belly while lifting your head (cow) to stretch the spine.
Kneel on one knee with the other foot in front, creating a 90-degree angle at both knees. Push your hips forward to stretch the hip flexor of the rear leg.
Sit on the floor with one leg extended and the other bent. Reach towards the toes of the extended leg to stretch the hamstring.
Use machines designed to assist with stretching various muscle groups, enhancing flexibility and range of motion.
Stand on one leg and hold the position, engaging your core to maintain balance. Repeat on the other leg.
Perform exercises (e.g., squats, lunges, push-ups) on a BOSU ball to challenge balance and stability.
Perform exercises (e.g., squats, lunges) on a balance board to improve balance and stability.
Perform exercises (e.g., squats, lunges, balance holds) on a balance pad to challenge stability and improve balance.
Use resistance bands to perform a variety of exercises (e.g., rows, presses, squats) to build strength and flexibility.
Run in place, lifting your knees to a comfortable height with each step.
Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Lift your heels off the ground and press onto your toes, then lower back down.
Swim continuously using various strokes (freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly) for a set distance or time to improve cardiovascular endurance and overall muscle strength.

Hold a stretch position for a set period (typically 15-60 seconds) without movement to improve flexibility and range of motion. Examples include hamstring stretch, quadriceps stretch, and shoulder stretch.
Walk in a straight line, placing the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot with each step. This exercise improves balance and coordination.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body by bending your knees, keeping your back straight. Return to the starting position.
Step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at 90 degrees. Push back to the starting position and repeat on the other leg.
Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
Lie face down, then lift your body onto your forearms and toes. Keep your back straight and hold the position.
Start in a high plank position. Drive your knees alternately towards your chest in a running motion.
Jump while spreading your arms and legs apart, then return to the starting position.
Stand upright and lift your heels off the ground, balancing on the balls of your feet. Lower back down slowly.
Lie face down with arms extended. Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground and hold briefly before lowering.
Stand with your back against a wall and slide down until your knees are at a 90-degree angle. Hold the position.
Sit on the floor with legs extended. Lift your legs a few inches off the ground and hold before lowering.
Step onto a bench with one foot, push through the heel, and bring the other foot up. Step back down and repeat.
Extend your arms and move them in small circles forward and backward.
Lie on your side and lift your top leg upward while keeping it straight. Lower and repeat.
Lie on your back and alternate bringing opposite elbows and knees together in a pedaling motion.
Sit on a chair, place hands on the edge, slide forward, and lower your body before pushing back up.
Lie on your back, lift your legs upward, and try to touch your toes with your hands. Lower and repeat.
Stand a few steps away from a wall, place your hands on it, and perform push-ups against the wall.
Lift your knees alternately while keeping a steady pace as if marching on the spot.
